Updating File Status Information

To compare files in your working folder to the repository files before checking them in or out, use the Update Status option. This option compares each file in the working folder with the revision you checked out and the tip revision. For example, the information in the File list may say that the file is Current, but because someone else has just checked in a copy of the file, its status is really Out Of Date.

Important: The Update Status option does not check files in or out. For example, if a file is not in your working folder, updating the status only informs you that the file status is set to Missing. Also, the Update Status option does not merge files.

Unlike refreshes of the upper pane, the Update Status option uses only the MD5 checksum (see Setting File Options). Refreshes use either the time stamp (and size) or the checksum, depending on the file options you have selected.

To update file status:

  1. Select one or more files from the upper pane.

  2. Select Update Status from the File or context menu. If the status currently displayed in the upper pane is incorrect, the application changes it. You should then take the appropriate action, based on the change.
